conclusion: Introduction to the problem scenario with motorcycle and car braking on a straight track.
Initial distance between motorcycle and car is 1.5 meters.
Objective is to find the minimum safe distance to prevent collision.
Motorcycle's velocity decreases linearly from 4 m/s at t=0 to 0 m/s at t=8 seconds.
Car's velocity is given by v2 = 3 - 0.25t.
Find time t' when motorcycle's speed equals car's speed by setting v1(t') = v2(t').
At t' = 4 seconds, both vehicles have the same velocity.
Calculate displacement of motorcycle by finding area under velocity-time graph from t=0 to t=4 seconds.
Displacement of motorcycle from t=0 to t=4 seconds is 12 meters.
Calculate displacement of car by integrating v2 from t=0 to t=4.
Displacement of car from t=0 to t=4 seconds is 10 meters.
